<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_connection_mark_closed_:
```c
void
MHD_connection_mark_closed_ (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  const struct MHD_Daemon *daemon = connection->daemon;

  if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_USE_TURBO))
  {
#ifdef HTTPS_SUPPORT
    /* For TLS connection use shutdown of TLS layer
     * and do not shutdown TCP socket. This give more
     * chances to send TLS closure data to remote side.
     * Closure of TLS layer will be interpreted by
     * remote side as end of transmission. */
    if (0 != (daemon->options & MHD_USE_TLS))
    {
      if (! MHD_tls_connection_shutdown (connection))
        shutdown (connection->socket_fd,
                  SHUT_WR);
    }
    else   /* Combined with next 'shutdown()'. */
#endif /* HTTPS_SUPPORT */
    shutdown (connection->socket_fd,
              SHUT_WR);
  }
  connection->state = MHD_CONNECTION_CLOSED;
  connection->event_loop_info = MHD_EVENT_LOOP_INFO_CLEANUP;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (! MHD_tls_connection_shutdown (connection))
        shutdown (connection->socket_fd,
                  SHUT_WR);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment: MHD_connection_mark_closed_ calls a different function, MHD_tls_connection_shutdown(), not itself. MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 forbids direct or indirect self-calls; there is no evidence here of direct recursion. An indirect recursion would only occur if MHD_tls_connection_shutdown (or another callee) calls back into MHD_connection_mark_closed_ (or otherwise creates a call cycle). Based on the provided code fragment alone, no such cycle is shown—so the rule is not violated. To be certain, inspect the implementation/call graph of MHD_tls_connection_shutdown for any calls back to MHD_connection_mark_closed_.
